item.title: Report E-2024100034
item.description:
Report E-2024100034

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-03T09:21:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-30
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAY experienced a UN2984 Peroxy Foam release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-quart of product released to a 1’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to a loose cap on the tote. The cap was tightened, and the tote re-secured for shipment on. The impacted trailer was cleaned with floor dry and pads. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were containerized into a vented 35-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100032
item.description:
Report E-2024100032

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-03T09:21:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 20, 2024, three (3) 1-gallon pails of UN1263 were damaged in unloading and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. The damaged pails were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. All spent absorbents were collected in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100027
item.description:
Report E-2024100027

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-03T09:21:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) quarts of material released from one (1) 1-gallon plastic pail due to improper loading of the freight. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized the recovered material into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. . The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090562
item.description:
Report E-2024090562

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-25
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCN experienced a UN1263 Durastar UC Medium Bronze BR4N160B release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3 ounces of product released to an 8’ x 4’ area of the trailer floor. The seam on the drum was damaged and leaked due to improper loading. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The impacted absorbents and damaged drum were containerized into an 85-gallon poly overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

OPENED THE PACKAGE, CLOSED THE VALVE ON THE CYLINDER, WORE REQUIRED PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT (PPE), FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, CLEANED UP AND REMOVED THE SPILL SAFELY

item.title: Report E-2024090517
item.description:
Report E-2024090517

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 13, 2024, two (2) 50-pound drums of UN3084 were damaged by a forklift and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE placed two (2) damaged 50 gallon drums into two (2) 95-gallon overpacks. All unaffected freight was then restacked and rewrapped for future terminal shipping. A HEPA vacuum unit was used to retain any loose product from the dock floor. All debris and waste were collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum which was staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090534
item.description:
Report E-2024090534

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: NORTH RIDGEVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4ft-by-4ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that approximately two (2) quarts of material released from one (1) 330-gallon composite tote due to a loose cap. Hepaco personnel stated that prior to their arrival terminal personnel hand tightened the cap and the tote was shipped onsite the consignee. Hepaco personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and placed the spent absorbents into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

Report E-2024090541

  • City: UNIONTOWN

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1848 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XAC. It was reported that approximately 3 gallons of Acetone was released from a 5-gallon Jerrican due to improper loading. The release impacted trailer #3114010. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. Terminal containerized the 5-gallon Jerrican of Acetone and waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.
